intro: Catanthera schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's catanthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged oppositely along the stem. Catanthera schlechteri is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
